I just watched it.




And I'm speechless.
Oh my god.
My Keen runs on Easy look like nothing in par to that. I may have to redo them all on Hard to at least feel better with myself [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
What's the total time?
Did you do all these highlights in one sitting???
Oh my god.

I see you recorded the run the proper way, the way SDA accepts it. I could verifiy your run once you're done and it would be posted on SDA, the home of most prestigous speedruns.

You gotta compress the video into something better though, like XviD AVI.

Good job, respect.

title: Re: Commander Keen 5 Video Clip
content:
Pretty neat video!
Somehow I really doubt that was all recored in one run; although every now and again I see myself doing those kinds of things, it usually feels like luck, although of course I can't deny a big part of it is in fact skill, since with just luck you'd only narrowly miss one enemy, not a whole series. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
Still, normally when cool things like that happen, I didn't voluntarily get into that situation; I screwed up my timing somewhere, missed a jump, so I simply have to run my behind of shooting in multiple directions... or let Keen do that anyway.
Where was I?
O yeah; pretty neat video! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Go Alex!
content:
It finally finished downloading. Those are some insane moves you pulled off, you definitely have skill. The remix worked out quite well in the end as well. Combined, they result in some immensely applaudable material. You threw it together really quick, too.

We need more clips like this!

Why don't you use DOSBox to record? It would make things much easier when it comes to compression.

title: Re: Go Alex!
content:
Yeah sorry about the size and all but my computer dosn't like recording through dosbox for some reason. Hopefully i can upgrade my pc and get it working properly then i can make more vids like this.

Anyway i'm just glad you guys enjoyed it [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

As for the remix it could have been better, but i couldn't save my work so i basically had to whip somthing up quickly and export it. So as you can probably tell i no longer have the source for it. Either way it didn't turn out that bad so yeah [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: haha
content:
Hey, not bad. If you're really gonna get picky about it, there's a few optimizations you could make. For example, at the very beginning of Ion Ventilation Center, because you hop from pole to pole, you actually get the downward-moving platform onscreen earlier than it needs to, and you have to fall a bit further than is optimal to land on it--if you instead jogged across the platform where the Sparky is, IP'ed up to snag the one long pole, and hopped off quickly, you could land on that platform a tiny bit sooner. Then, gauge your pogo heights a bit more accurately so you don't lose time waiting for Keen to fall back down.

I've been lurking over at the TAS Videos forum over the past year or so ( http://tasvideos.org ) and it's a vicious perfectionist thing to do, speedrunning. The presentation of this video does a good job of highlighting the exciting parts, and the combination of remixed music and sweep effect keep the pacing nice...

But if you want this to be honestly considered, as a speedrun, you're gonna have to encode the whole 'boring' thing, start to finish, with no saves/loads.
